title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.23 | 19-04-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: by attentive devotion and meditation, the Lord releases the devotee from the bondage of fructive activities exactly at the time of quitting the body.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and explains how attentive devotion, meditation, and chanting the holy name can liberate a devotee from fruitive activities at the time of death.

segments.key_quote: Even though a devotee is not, may not be engaged in Ashtanga Yoga practice, in Bhakti Yoga also the same perfection of Ashtanga Yoga called Samadhi or cent per cent absorption in the Supreme Lord is possible.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's purport is discussed, emphasizing that Bhakti Yoga can achieve the same perfection as Ashtanga Yoga (Samadhi) through devotional service, chanting, hearing, worshipping, and remembering the Lord.

segments.key_quote: devotee means bhakti yogi of the lord engages himself 24 hours daily in the service of the lord so that his whole attention is engrossed with the thoughts of the lord in ninefold devotional service
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the nine processes of devotional service as described in the Srimad Bhagavatam, including hearing, chanting, remembering, worshiping, praying, serving, carrying out orders, establishing a friendly relationship, and offering everything to the Lord.

segments.key_quote: The Lord calls such a rare devotee, the best amongst all the Yogis
segments.summary: The lecture references the Bhagavad Gita to explain that a devotee absorbed in devotional service 24 hours a day is considered the best of all yogis, enabled by the Lord's divine grace to concentrate perfectly.

segments.key_quote: Generally, those who are non-devotees, their background consciousness is that of sense enjoyment, or self-gratification, the sense of independent existence without any connection with Krishna
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the importance of consciousness, contrasting the sense enjoyment and independent existence of non-devotees with the perfect sense of consciousness characterized by absolute dependence on Krishna.

segments.key_quote: And the Lord is very, very merciful and kind to his pure devotee, unflinching servitor.
segments.summary: The lecture explains that the Lord's mercy enables a pure devotee to be transferred to the eternal planets by the internal energy (yoga maya), contrasting it with the material energy (maha maya) that creates obstacles.

segments.key_quote: In the eternal planets, there is no death, there is no old age.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the suffering of material existence (birth, death, disease, old age) with the eternal nature of the spiritual planets, emphasizing that this knowledge is not widely known.

segments.key_quote: If you are not guided by a pure devotee, spiritual master, you will never understand all these things merely by your reading the Gita.
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by stressing the importance of guidance from a pure devotee and spiritual master to understand the Bhagavad Gita and the possibility of transferring oneself to the eternal planets through devotional service and chanting at the time of death.
